intro: Oxytropis ochrantha, commonly known as the yellow locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Oxytropis ochrantha is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with well-drained soils.
